article.class: fl-post post-5 page type-page status-publish hentry

em.span: Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers announced this afternoon that "all public and private K-12 schools shall remain closed for pupil instruction and extracurricular activities for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year." In addition, the “Stay Safer at Home” order is in effect until May 26, 2020

p.span: South Shore School located in Port Wing Wisconsin is on the south shore of the "Big Lake", Lake Superior. The District was founded in 1895. It was the first consolidated school district in Wisconsin. Today at South Shore School District, school and community work together to inspire life-long learning and develop successful, creative and compassionate people.

"South Shore Schools exist to provide an environment in which students, parents, staff, and community members work together to encourage lifelong learning, and support students' education and efforts to develop their potential as successful, creative and compassionate people."

We have received recognition as a "New Wisconsin Promise School of Recognition" for eleven years in a row in the Elementary School and for ten years in a row for the Jr/Sr High School. Our school report card scores are consistently high, among the very best scores in the State. For the 2018-19 school year the elementary school received a score of "excellent, exceeds expectations" and the secondary received a score of "meets expectations".

CLICK HERE for the latest

div.a: View a Mobile Version of this Calendar

div.div:
&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&
Remember, orders for next week’s food delivery are due by NOON on Wednesdays). Email: fooddrop@sshore.org or 715 774 3500 ext 625. No late exceptions.
OR
if you want meals delivered for every school day for the duration of the closure, Call and/or email and tell us duration and leave student(s) name. bus route driver, etc. If you choose “duration”, then you do not need to order every week.
&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&

********************
Extension Ashland & Bayfield Counties will present Successful Co-Parenting on Monday, April 27 via Zoom from noon-3:00 p.m. This workshop is offered several times per year (typically face-to-face) in Ashland and Bayfield Counties. Our regularly scheduled April Class is now being offered online via Zoom in a live, interactive, discussion-based format. In light of financial impacts resulting from COVID-19, the fee for this class is waived. This session will also include special information on co-parenting during COVID-19.
Successful Co-Parenting is a class for divorcing or separated parents and others in co-parenting families. It offers tools to help co-parents…
support the emotional well-being of children
work effectively with the other parent/caregiver and
keep children out of the middle of family conflict.
Participants must register through Extension. Visit https://bayfield.extension.wisc.edu/ to register. For questions, call 715-373-3288.
********************

********************
posted 4/14/2020
MEAL DELIVERY
INFORMATION DURING SCHOOL CLOSURE
School meal service is planned has begun. Meals will be bagged cold.
Lunch and Breakfast for the following day will be provided each day..
Meals will be delivered to your bus stop spot.
Buses will be leaving the school at 1100 am
Please be flexible with our delivery times.
Please have an open container for your meal bag to be dropped into, so we can protect our employees. (open cooler, box, basket)
When you are picking up your meals please do not get too close to the bus or people on it to maintain our social distancing.
Pending the length of the closure, please be reminded there will be no meal service on dates that school was originally planned to be closed on the school calendar.
April 24 and May 25
Meals can also be provided for siblings under 18 in the household if they have a student attending So Shore School
You need to sign up for this service every week unless you opt to have meals delivered every school day of the closure by specifing “duration”. Then you do not need to call every week.
You need to Sign-Up by NOON Wednesday of the prior week unless you have chosen “duration”. Please call to select the duration option.
Email: fooddrop@sshore.org
OR
Phone: 715-774-3500 x625
​Be sure to tell us your students name(s) , name of sibling (s) in the email, along with the name of the bus driver that services your route. Please indicate what days you wish meals delivered. Sign-UP online is recommended.
********************

********************
NOTICE: When you do a meal order now you have the option of saying “for the duration of the closure”. If you choose the “duration” then you DO NOT have to order every week.
********************

********************
NOTICE:
All children in household (age 18 and under) may receive school meals as long as at least one child is attending South Shore.
Call 715-774-3500 ext. 625 to sign up.
********************

********************
So Shore BOOK FAIR
Never been a better time to get some new books to read and share and support the PTO at the same time. This is the link to the Book Fair, which starts Monday, April 13 and continues until April 27.CLICK BELOW:https://bookfairs.scholastic.com/bookfairs/cptoolkit/homepage.do?method=homepage&url=southshoreelementaryschool1
********************

br.b: Sign Up Codes for Updates on School Services During Closure

br.span: We will frequently send out announcements, important information, etc. to students/parents/guardians. In order to effectively do this, we would like to use:
In order to sign up for this service, go to remind.com and use the following codes:

br.b: South Shore Elementary Students, Parents, Guardians, Staff – use this code: @4522EL
South Shore Jr/Sr High Students, Parents, Guardians, Staff – use this code: @4522jrsr

br.span: This system can give emails and text messages. This is very important for our students/parents to have this information, so please sign up as soon as possible.
